Name: Stela of Neb-eskhoye
Description: In the centre of the upper and largest register, the mummiform god Osiris is depicted on a block throne and facing left. Behind him stand the falcon-headed god Horus and the goddess Isis. At far right, a ceremonial flagellum (nekhakha-sceptre) is shown. Opposite Osiris is a low offering table with several offerings and a man bending his upper body while raising his arms in adoration.In the second register is a couple on the left, sitting on a chair. In front of them is a low offering table with dishes and a row of six figures.In the bottom register, two couples sitting on chairs are depicted, one on each side. They are also receiving offerings.
